title.narrative: KH 2018: contribute to reduction in prevalence of child marriage in Mondulkiri

description.narrative: AS CA // Ensure Sexual Reproductive Health Rights (SRHR) and Prevent Child Sexual Abuse (CA) in Asia

title.narrative: 3.1 Project staff are the relevant ressources to implement participatory sessions with child clubs

description.narrative: 3.1 Project staff are the relevant ressources to implement participatory sessions with child clubs

title.narrative: 3.1 (new) # session child club currriculum created

description.narrative: 3.1 (new) # session child club currriculum created

comment.narrative:
A curriculum session was organised during partner workshop in June.
The content will be in English and Khmer version.;
The project used mostly the existing curriculum developed in 2019. Media One requested to submit final version of modules. They did created a video-based tutorial for C4D training.;

description.narrative: 3.2 Project staff are equipped with the relevant skills set to facilitate child clubs

title.narrative: 3.2 (new) # project staff who demonstrate increased competency levels to stay overnight in villages and facilitate children as agents of changes (both monitored quarterly)

description.narrative: 3.2 (new) # project staff who demonstrate increased competency levels to stay overnight in villages and facilitate children as agents of changes (both monitored quarterly)

comment.narrative: 5 field staffs (3 TdH staffs and 2 MEDIA One staffs) stayed overnight in their target villages to provide coaching before the child club meeting and village meeting. Staff built their capacity to set and review objectives for overnight stay.;

comment.narrative: 15 sessions conducted in 11 locations.;

title.narrative: # of vulnerable children participated in awareness raising sessions

description.narrative: # of vulnerable children participated in awareness raising sessions

comment.narrative: 192 vulnerable children participated in child club meetings (61 vulnerable boys, 129 vulnerable girls).;

BY this quarter there were 81 session of child club awareness raising meeting. Through these 81 sessions, there were 2781 (1806 girls) child club members attended. Among of them, there were 2732 (1796 girls) vulnerable children. Calculation : total 2732 - 192 from previous quarter;
Partner purchase materials for production of content (C4D);

description.narrative: (new) # events in which representatives from different child clubs meet and work together as agents of change

comment.narrative: By this quarter, there were two time that volunteer from different group joined together to facilitate the child club session meeting. Those session have 6 (6 females) volunteers from child club facilitator and social media volunteer team for the participants of 87 (47 girls) child club members.;

title.narrative: (new) # vulnerable children who demonstrate a basic competency (level 1) to facilitate their peers as agents of change

description.narrative: (new) # vulnerable children who demonstrate a basic competency (level 1) to facilitate their peers as agents of change

comment.narrative: It linked to output 2.2 and 2.3, for volunteer there are 80% of them have increased knowledge on participatory monitoring and evaluation (PME), know how to use social media and facilitation skill. However, the project have conducted the assessment for assess the capacity of vulnerable children who benefited from the project yet.;
expenses related to M1 training;

description.narrative: 3.6 (new) # media content produced by child clubs

comment.narrative: 5 audio spots, 4 audio drama, 4 videos and 1 case story were produced by adult volunteers.;

A total of 9 videos (7 awareness videos and 2 case stories) were produced by adult volunteers during Q4. Facebook page "Anakut Komar" was succesfully created by adult volunteers with total 23 posts and 61.2K reach, 12.7K engagement and 366 page likes.;

description.narrative: 3.7 ( new) # village level events led by children to share research

comment.narrative: 1 session - 15 events in 11 locations;

There were 10 village KPI meetings organised by project volunteers at 10 target villages with a total of 286 participants (192 females, 173 vulnerable children) included gatekeepers to share the village data and village indicators.;

comment.narrative: 10 village KPI meetings and 10 annual village review meetings were organised by adult volunteers with engagement of local authorities and community members at 10 target villages during Q4.;

title.narrative: A close relationship is built with DWCCC and CCWC through the project

description.narrative: A close relationship is built with DWCCC and CCWC through the project

title.narrative: # of meetings held with government officials

description.narrative: # of meetings held with government officials

comment.narrative:
In this period of time, ECM project working closely with department of Education, Healthy, Social Security staff and other stakeholder to support through meeting:
1). District WCCC: 2 meeting: 26ps (F: 14ps) and 2). Commune CWC: 9 meeting in total 120ps (F: 37ps).;

TDH MDK team continued participating in meetings with CCWVC, DWCCC. There was growing effort to build a local advocacy strategy. They were also invited in September by the provincial governor to present the project.;

This quarter, project support to 7 regular monthly meetings with 103 (36 F) participants included 17 (16 F) of volunteers; 2 DWCCC meetings for 25 (12 F) and 6 CCWC meetings for 78 (24 F). In the meeting, they follow to the set out agenda while the project volunteer, TdH-NL and M1 could share the achievements, provide opportunity for volunteer to attended and raise up their activities in the community related with ECM. They also review last meeting action plan and its achievement, discuss on related situations of health, education, social security, Covid19, and ECM.;

title.narrative: Adult volunteers are able to support child led behaviour change initiatives

description.narrative: Adult volunteers are able to support child led behaviour change initiatives

title.narrative: (new) % adult volunteers who demonstrate a change in KAP

description.narrative: (new) % adult volunteers who demonstrate a change in KAP

comment.narrative: 80% of adult volunteers increased knowledge on participatory monitoring and evaluation (PME) and over 80% of them increased knowledge and how to use social media.;

The KAP survey pre-test could not happen in Q2 because of delays in implementation related to COVID. KAP Survey was finalized in July and baseline data will be collected in August.
Actual is Q2 is negative due to the adjustment of wrong report in Q1. The system is not allowed to report that negative balance of Eur 1635.68;
implementation of KAP survey was delayed because project team needed extra support on this (new tool).;

comment.narrative: 10 annual review meetings were successfully conducted at 10 target villages with a total of 317 participants (237 women, 93 vulnerable children) to review and tracking early marriage in each village.;

title.narrative: # of community members with children vulnerable to exploitation participated in awareness raising activities

comment.narrative: - There were 421 participants attended in KPI and Annual review at village level including: (1). A total of 198 community members (131 females, 43 vulnerable boys, 61 vulnerable girls) attended village KPI meetings and (2). A total of 223 community members (176 females, 10 vulnerable boys, 19 vulnerable girls) attended village annual review meetings. - By this quarter, there are 2601 (old participants) vulnerable children included 1636 girls to attended in Child Club meeting session activities.;

A total of 742 community members participated in ECM project activities included 550 participants in child club orientation (403 females, 118 vulnerable boys and 252 vulnerable girls, 1 abused girl) and 190 vulnerable children participated in child club meetings (61 vulnerable boys, 129 vulnerable girls).;
overspending by partner in Jan and Feb reported in this quarter - spent for development of tutorials.;
